references.paper_title: Improved algorithms for linear stochastic bandits
references.reason: This paper provides foundational algorithms for linear stochastic bandits, which are closely related to the contextual dynamic pricing problem studied in this paper.

references.paper_title: Dynamic pricing without knowing the demand function: Risk bounds and near-optimal algorithms
references.reason: This paper is a seminal work in dynamic pricing, providing risk bounds and algorithms for settings without full knowledge of the demand function, which is relevant to the contextual dynamic pricing setting.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the theory of "-armed bandits, which forms the theoretical basis for many of the algorithms used in contextual dynamic pricing.
This paper addresses the challenge of dynamic pricing in high-dimensional settings, directly relevant to the contextual dynamic pricing problem where context is high dimensional.

references.paper_title: Nearly tight bounds for the continuum-armed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper establishes nearly tight bounds for the continuum-armed bandit problem, which provides a benchmark for the performance of algorithms in the related contextual dynamic pricing setting.
